entry.content:
just two steps

1.generate key pairs if not exist

ssh-keygen -t rsa

If success, you will find id_rsa and id_rsa.pub in the ~/.ssh/ dir

2.copy the public key to the server you want to login

ssh-copy-id username@hostname

Then, it will authorize your permission by password.

If both steps is done, you can ssh to the server without password input. In the ~/.ssh/authorized_key file on the server, you will find an entry like:

sh-rsa  XX@XX
